Katya smiled. She took some pride in the fact that Owlhawk was 
interested by her teaching.

Katya: Taking a bondsman is honoring a worthy foe. Phelan Kell took 
Ragnar as a bondsman because he had been an able and intelligent 
warrior, something Phelan knew would serve the Wolves. Ragnar served 
for about two years as a mech technician before he was deemed worthy 
to become a warrior again. The same thing happened when he was 
captured by the Ghost Bears. In short, the bondsman serves the 
bondsmaster and pushes himself to become a warrior once more. Does 
that clear things up, quiaff?
